subject: Add doc8 rule and check doc/source files
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-08-23 12:27:41.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/qos_minimum_bandwidth_rule.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/availability_zone.rst', 'test-requirements.txt', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/network_ip_availability.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/rbac_policy.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/load_balancer/v2/health_monitor.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/security_group_rule.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/auto_allocated_topology.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/metering_label_rule.rst', 'doc/source/users/guides/network.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/service_profile.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/metering_label.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/compute/v2/limits.rst', 'doc/source/contributors/index.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/health_monitor.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/compute/v2/server_interface.rst', 'doc/source/users/guides/compute.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/service_provider.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/metric/v1/archive_policy.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/security_group.rst', 'doc/source/users/guides/logging.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/qos_dscp_marking_rule.rst', 'doc/source/users/resources/network/v2/qos_bandwidth_limit_rule.rst', 'doc/source/contributors/testing.rst', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add doc8 rule and check doc/source files

doc8 is a linter for documents and used in openstack-manuals.
It is better to enforce document linters for simple checking.
This change is to add doc8 in tox file and fix line too long
in some files.

The current rules are as bellow:
- invalid rst format - D000
- lines should not be longer than 79 characters - D001
  - RST exception: line with no whitespace except in the beginning
  - RST exception: lines with http or https urls
  - RST exception: literal blocks
  - RST exception: rst target directives
- no trailing whitespace - D002
- no tabulation for indentation - D003
- no carriage returns (use unix newlines) - D004
- no newline at end of file - D005

Change-Id: I5b409fbfd95e05921310c6ecf4afea0220fb0bf0
'}]
commit_message:
Add doc8 rule and check doc/source files

doc8 is a linter for documents and used in openstack-manuals.
It is better to enforce document linters for simple checking.
This change is to add doc8 in tox file and fix line too long
in some files.

The current rules are as bellow:
- invalid rst format - D000
- lines should not be longer than 79 characters - D001
  - RST exception: line with no whitespace except in the beginning
  - RST exception: lines with http or https urls
  - RST exception: literal blocks
  - RST exception: rst target directives
- no trailing whitespace - D002
- no tabulation for indentation - D003
- no carriage returns (use unix newlines) - D004
- no newline at end of file - D005

Change-Id: I5b409fbfd95e05921310c6ecf4afea0220fb0bf0

revisions:

The l7rules patch had a bad rebase and ended up getting merged in a broken
state as indicated by the functional test gate failure (non-voting).

This patch fixes this issues from the bad rebase and allows the tests to pass.

Change-Id: I4b2270f32c467e18d6ec203f20692685453687cd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix octavia l7rules

The l7rules patch had a bad rebase and ended up getting merged in a broken
state as indicated by the functional test gate failure (non-voting).

This patch fixes this issues from the bad rebase and allows the tests to pass.

Change-Id: I4b2270f32c467e18d6ec203f20692685453687cd

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-18 14:05:05.000000000', 'files': ['roles/overcloud-deploy/tasks/pre-deploy.yml', 'roles/overcloud-deploy/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Support container_override_args

For a containerized_overcloud scenario, the composable scenario arguments defined in
'scenario_args' are included in the overcloud deploy command before the 'container_args'.
If the composable scenario template wants to override some of the parameters like changing
the neutron plugin etc it is not possible. So this patch supports a new argument
'container_override_args' which is included after the 'container_args'.

This is required for OVN container scenario, where in we want to override
'OS::TripleO::Docker::NeutronMl2PluginBase' to 'puppet/services/neutron-plugin-ml2-ovn.yaml'.

Partial-bug: #1699085
Change-Id: If5a9f2e895a91f57751637b45abf1c60188c0872
"}]
commit_message:
Support container_override_args

For a containerized_overcloud scenario, the composable scenario arguments defined in
'scenario_args' are included in the overcloud deploy command before the 'container_args'.
If the composable scenario template wants to override some of the parameters like changing
the neutron plugin etc it is not possible. So this patch supports a new argument
'container_override_args' which is included after the 'container_args'.

This is required for OVN container scenario, where in we want to override
'OS::TripleO::Docker::NeutronMl2PluginBase' to 'puppet/services/neutron-plugin-ml2-ovn.yaml'.

Partial-bug: #1699085
Change-Id: If5a9f2e895a91f57751637b45abf1c60188c0872

revisions:

A fully hyper-converged deployment is fine, but this has not
been done with an agreed spec, nor has it been completed.

This patch is being reverted with the agreement that there
will be a spec and we can tackle this properly in Queens.

This reverts commit b769a6e0c128b96b23dd696a305145f2077c3151.

Change-Id: Ia7ac1084db7610800dca7a860fddc2ad825fa101
(cherry picked from commit 4cba47c1d3a186d189c75e903cbb8be39602fa0f)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Reduce container counts for cinder, ironic and trove"

A fully hyper-converged deployment is fine, but this has not
been done with an agreed spec, nor has it been completed.

This patch is being reverted with the agreement that there
will be a spec and we can tackle this properly in Queens.

This reverts commit b769a6e0c128b96b23dd696a305145f2077c3151.

Change-Id: Ia7ac1084db7610800dca7a860fddc2ad825fa101
(cherry picked from commit 4cba47c1d3a186d189c75e903cbb8be39602fa0f)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-04-12 07:52:32.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/connection_manager.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_connection_manager.py'], 'message': "Use keystone sessions for swift's connection manager

Sessions are recommended instead of having to manage tokens manually,
and swiftclient supports this. So this switched the connection manager
code to pass those instead.

Also, since keystoneauth's sessions handle the re-authentication, that
bit was removed.

Change-Id: I5d4699520b89b7a73a6870346849ea9c0072bbbf
"}]
commit_message:
Use keystone sessions for swift's connection manager

Sessions are recommended instead of having to manage tokens manually,
and swiftclient supports this. So this switched the connection manager
code to pass those instead.

Also, since keystoneauth's sessions handle the re-authentication, that
bit was removed.

Change-Id: I5d4699520b89b7a73a6870346849ea9c0072bbbf

commit_message:
Add keystone auth_url for creating the workflow client

mistralclient is moving away from using the kestoneclient code and going
forward to using just keystoneauth. This, however means that it's no
longer assuming the auth_url. So we need to pass it.

Change-Id: Ia046fbd008a8118b28d135239370c49873248849

subject: Use persistent fernet-keys repo for keystone container
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-09 11:03:58.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/keystone.yaml'], 'message': 'Use persistent fernet-keys repo for keystone container

This creates /etc/keystone/fernet-keys in the overcloud host (or at
least it ensures it exists), and bind-mounts that to bot the container
running puppet and the keystone container itself. This allows us to do
key rotations easily and make those persistent.

Change-Id: I1e68e93e93fe8d53f7fa741ac24d64aed4422db0
'}]
commit_message:
Use persistent fernet-keys repo for keystone container

This creates /etc/keystone/fernet-keys in the overcloud host (or at
least it ensures it exists), and bind-mounts that to bot the container
running puppet and the keystone container itself. This allows us to do
key rotations easily and make those persistent.

Change-Id: I1e68e93e93fe8d53f7fa741ac24d64aed4422db0

subject: Fix regexp for detecting long options
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-08-22 17:53:21.000000000', 'files': ['cliff/tests/test_sphinxext.py', 'cliff/sphinxext.py'], 'message': "Fix regexp for detecting long options

This commit fixes regexp in order to detect mandatory long arguments
with hyphen like '--foo-bar <foo-bar>'.

Note that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/496189/ fixes the bug
paritally but it does not cover all cases.

Closes-Bug: #1706311
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I52b9fdecbf1abea1f819b0061fd80b7ca6e0906d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix regexp for detecting long options

This commit fixes regexp in order to detect mandatory long arguments
with hyphen like '--foo-bar <foo-bar>'.

Note that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/496189/ fixes the bug
paritally but it does not cover all cases.

Closes-Bug: #1706311
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I52b9fdecbf1abea1f819b0061fd80b7ca6e0906d

commit_message:
Add opendaylight role to tests a-r-r

In order to pass the lint test, all meta-dep
roles for the roles we execute in the test must
be present. As the os_neutron role recently got
the opendaylight role added as a meta-dep it is
now required here too.

Change-Id: I44dec03565e5be74cf3a03961e47180e50cf88a8

subject: Trigger TripleO scenario001 and 004 on Mistral workflow changes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-22 14:30:41.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Trigger TripleO scenario001 and 004 on Mistral workflow changes

From Pike it will be possible to deploy Ceph via ceph-ansible in
TripleO. This is implemented triggering a Mistral workflow which
executes ansible on the undercloud.

This change executes tripleo scenario001 and scenario004 on
updates for the workflow.

Change-Id: Ia5771c85cad6431082daf32110cca15568a64161
'}]
commit_message:
Trigger TripleO scenario001 and 004 on Mistral workflow changes

From Pike it will be possible to deploy Ceph via ceph-ansible in
TripleO. This is implemented triggering a Mistral workflow which
executes ansible on the undercloud.

This change executes tripleo scenario001 and scenario004 on
updates for the workflow.

Change-Id: Ia5771c85cad6431082daf32110cca15568a64161

commit_message:
Revert "Add ALLOCATING state to routers"

This reverts commit 9c3c19f07ce52e139d431aec54341c38a183f0b7.

Following the merge of Ie98d5e3760cdb17450aea546f4b61f5ba14baf1c, the
creation of new router uses RouterL3AgentBinding and its' new
binding_index attribute to ensure correctness of the resources. As such,
the ALLOCATING state (which was used to do just that) is no longer
needed and can be removed.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_db.py
	neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py
	neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py

Closes-Bug: #1609738
Change-Id: Ib04e08df13ef4e6b94bd588854a5795163e2a617
(cherry picked from commit 3e4c0ae223de776732f70626b387fba4de2e9c3f)

commit_message:
Separate greenfield and upgrade tests

In order to independently test a greenfield deploy
and an upgrade, with the upgrade's initial deploy
using the previous stable branch role, we seperate
the two tests.

This makes it a more accurate test without having
to do funky workarounds in the role required to
cater for two versions of galera.

Depends-On: Ic881bf3acf6fb6daf71611c26322f02fb8b0b9be

subject: scripts: scripts-library.sh: Hide 'which' command output
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-21 14:02:34.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'message': "scripts: scripts-library.sh: Hide 'which' command output

If systemd-resolve is not available, then we get the following error
in the output

which: no systemd-resolve in (/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin)

We only care about the 'which' exit code so lets just hide
stdout/stderr.

Change-Id: Ia6597e68d8237f6d5ab2acb86116dbaa31465e12
"}]
commit_message:
scripts: scripts-library.sh: Hide 'which' command output

If systemd-resolve is not available, then we get the following error
in the output

which: no systemd-resolve in (/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin)

We only care about the 'which' exit code so lets just hide
stdout/stderr.

Change-Id: Ia6597e68d8237f6d5ab2acb86116dbaa31465e12

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-01 09:33:00.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/common/utils/data_utils.py'], 'message': 'Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

oslo_utils has a generate_uuid() function, which can
accept dashed (boolean) parameter, which generate uuids
equivalent to uuid.uuid4().hex. For consistence, we should
use the oslo_utils generate_uuid() function.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2472f4b341198988afdc11dd3ffe599020b991b4
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

oslo_utils has a generate_uuid() function, which can
accept dashed (boolean) parameter, which generate uuids
equivalent to uuid.uuid4().hex. For consistence, we should
use the oslo_utils generate_uuid() function.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2472f4b341198988afdc11dd3ffe599020b991b4

subject: Write user parameters environment to swift
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-08-17 15:01:50.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Write user parameters environment to swift

Currently we only merge this into the local merged environment,
but instead we should write it as a separate user-environment in
swift, which will enable heat server side parameter merging to
work in future.  The _write_user_environment function is added to
handle writing the file to the local tmpdir tht_root, and uploading
the same data to the plan.

Partial-Bug: #1635409
Change-Id: I74bde48ef18c2e59233b7535578f394fbd1f7553
'}]
commit_message:
Write user parameters environment to swift

Currently we only merge this into the local merged environment,
but instead we should write it as a separate user-environment in
swift, which will enable heat server side parameter merging to
work in future.  The _write_user_environment function is added to
handle writing the file to the local tmpdir tht_root, and uploading
the same data to the plan.

Partial-Bug: #1635409
Change-Id: I74bde48ef18c2e59233b7535578f394fbd1f7553

commit_message:
tox: Add 'profiler' target

There's no reason that the OS profiler has to run every time I run a
subset of the unit tests. Move the profiler tests into their own tox
target and add this to the default list of targets.

Change-Id: I62dbd84ce767fec9b45aabeafcee3d7af7571d73

commit_message:
Add redirect from resource-cluster to clustering

The service-types-authority changed senlin's service-type to
resource-cluster a bit too eagerly. Make sure that any links to

place.

subject: Add securityGroups param to NovaNetwork joinInstance method in Core Library
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-23 07:05:53.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/NovaNetwork.yaml'], 'message': 'Add securityGroups param to NovaNetwork joinInstance method in Core Library

Commit 103f67815a1cb2c514241fbf2e897684b5a269ae added a securityGroups
parameter to the joinInstance method in meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/
Instance.yaml, but not in meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/
NovaNetwork.yaml. This omission makes deployments with Nova Network as a
driver fail. This commit adds the securityGroups parameter to
NovaNetwork.yaml.

Change-Id: If814d48d6491f1e16a5fb2b8632723224071d575
Closes-Bug: #1710576
(cherry picked from commit 075f5777d9db7fd90f6c897e386753ac1e1ec858)
'}]
commit_message:
Add securityGroups param to NovaNetwork joinInstance method in Core Library

Commit 103f67815a1cb2c514241fbf2e897684b5a269ae added a securityGroups
parameter to the joinInstance method in meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/
Instance.yaml, but not in meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/
NovaNetwork.yaml. This omission makes deployments with Nova Network as a
driver fail. This commit adds the securityGroups parameter to
NovaNetwork.yaml.

Change-Id: If814d48d6491f1e16a5fb2b8632723224071d575
Closes-Bug: #1710576
(cherry picked from commit 075f5777d9db7fd90f6c897e386753ac1e1ec858)

subject: Ensure assigned-ips output is present in Heat template with Nova Network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-23 07:05:25.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/NovaNetwork.yaml'], 'message': 'Ensure assigned-ips output is present in Heat template with Nova Network

When using Murano with Nova Network, the assigned-ips output is only added to
the template when a floating IP is assigned. This makes the deployment fail
when the engine tries to get the list of IPs of the created instance.

This patch makes sure that the hostname-assigned-ips output is added to the
template also when a floating IP is not assigned.

Change-Id: I8970a34e7c0b9fefdc236b046d6506f778143f3a
Closes-Bug: 1710623
(cherry picked from commit 3990acfcce6b9f1dd9bde9ceb7e0817c19acff34)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure assigned-ips output is present in Heat template with Nova Network

When using Murano with Nova Network, the assigned-ips output is only added to
the template when a floating IP is assigned. This makes the deployment fail
when the engine tries to get the list of IPs of the created instance.

This patch makes sure that the hostname-assigned-ips output is added to the
template also when a floating IP is not assigned.

Change-Id: I8970a34e7c0b9fefdc236b046d6506f778143f3a
Closes-Bug: 1710623
(cherry picked from commit 3990acfcce6b9f1dd9bde9ceb7e0817c19acff34)

subject: sphinxext: Correct issues with usage formatting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 10:17:26.000000000', 'files': ['cliff/tests/test_sphinxext.py', 'cliff/sphinxext.py'], 'message': "sphinxext: Correct issues with usage formatting

There are two issues here stemming from required options:

- If the option contains a hyphen, e.g. '--required-option', then it is
  split into multiple tokens
- The arguments for these options are not surrounded by triangular
  brackets like optional options are, but these are expected

Correct both issues.

Change-Id: Ifc20e6936a9ce4ef4f22b2c17298d6ca552640f7
"}]
commit_message:
sphinxext: Correct issues with usage formatting

There are two issues here stemming from required options:

- If the option contains a hyphen, e.g. '--required-option', then it is
  split into multiple tokens
- The arguments for these options are not surrounded by triangular
  brackets like optional options are, but these are expected

Correct both issues.

Change-Id: Ifc20e6936a9ce4ef4f22b2c17298d6ca552640f7

commit_message:
Revert "Reduce container counts for cinder, ironic and trove"

A fully hyper-converged deployment is fine, but this has not
been done with an agreed spec, nor has it been completed.

This patch is being reverted with the agreement that there
will be a spec and we can tackle this properly in Queens.

This reverts commit b769a6e0c128b96b23dd696a305145f2077c3151.

Change-Id: Ia7ac1084db7610800dca7a860fddc2ad825fa101

subject: Update the playbook serial settings
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-23 04:55:53.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-neutron-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml'], 'message': "Update the playbook serial settings

Many of our playbooks enfore the serial deployment of services. While
this is useful in certain cases It's super slow on large scale
deployments. This change modifies our serial settings so that many of
the services are deployed against 1 node first and then all the rest of
the services where it makes.

Change-Id: I842e98ebc29e0da0c3d7af3fd1d7f5592dfb3aa3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit eb81d64351dd12a1acbfef368ca27b73171fc6a3)

commit_message:
Update the playbook serial settings

Many of our playbooks enfore the serial deployment of services. While
this is useful in certain cases It's super slow on large scale
deployments. This change modifies our serial settings so that many of
the services are deployed against 1 node first and then all the rest of
the services where it makes.

Change-Id: I842e98ebc29e0da0c3d7af3fd1d7f5592dfb3aa3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit eb81d64351dd12a1acbfef368ca27b73171fc6a3)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 14:28:10.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/irmc/boot.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_deploy_utils.py'], 'message': "Fix names of capabilities for FibreChannel volume boot

Cinder uses 'fibre_channel' to for the volume type for FibreChannel
volumes. This value is returned as 'driver_volume_type' when
initialize_connection API. Then, nova sets the value to a volume target
of ironic.

The capabilities names of interfaces to allow FC boot are expected to
use the value in populating[1]. This patch fixes the capabilities names
from 'fc' to 'fibre_channel'.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/c0ce6ebf1988c29cc68d16fc2e9142a022f7024b/ironic/drivers/modules/deploy_utils.py#L1263,L1268

Partial-bug: #1559691
(cherry picked from commit e6f09618a58f9af8671d0ba6bda6f3ee92a90efa)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix names of capabilities for FibreChannel volume boot

Cinder uses 'fibre_channel' to for the volume type for FibreChannel
volumes. This value is returned as 'driver_volume_type' when
initialize_connection API. Then, nova sets the value to a volume target
of ironic.

The capabilities names of interfaces to allow FC boot are expected to
use the value in populating[1]. This patch fixes the capabilities names
from 'fc' to 'fibre_channel'.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/c0ce6ebf1988c29cc68d16fc2e9142a022f7024b/ironic/drivers/modules/deploy_utils.py#L1263,L1268

Change-Id: I9ff3c55cff035b0ff87b36da820f8129a9ffcbe2
Partial-bug: #1559691
(cherry picked from commit e6f09618a58f9af8671d0ba6bda6f3ee92a90efa)

commit_message:
Make cirros-example v3 compatible

This example seems broken. Though it will work if you
change the auth_url to point to /v2.0 rather than /v3, it's
better to make it work with v3 (the default now for all
keystone deployments).

commit_message:
Move neutron multinode job to check pipeline

neutron multinode job
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv
run in experimental pipeline in Tempest and sometime missed to
check.

This bug#1709739 expose some issue which can occur in API tests
in multinode env only.
This is job which runs API tests in multinode env and it is worth to
check the API tests behaviour in multinode env to detect such issues.

Nova and Neutron run this job in check pipeline.

Note- this is nv job so no impact on check pipeline.

Change-Id: I0d97593cb470d24d2835fc34a1cc687f880d10b3
Related-Bug: #1709739

commit_message:
Fix amqp1 non-voting job failures

amqp1 plugin for devstack does not work with
"CELLSV2_SETUP=superconductor" i.e. one conductor per cell managing
compute services, which is the default with devstack. Change it for
this job to avoid the job failures.

Change-Id: I6cb8b17333f8c04b7a98c96bd9be1e211b77973d

subject: Remove/migrate Fedora 25 jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-23 01:23:10.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/infra.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/windmill.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/ansible-role-jobs.yaml', 'nodepool/nodepool.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove/migrate Fedora 25 jobs

Fedora 26 is working with devstack jobs and (with bindep 2.5.0) tox
testing.  We wish to stop Fedora 25 builds to reduce the daily upload
requirements (but also, we try to keep this on the most recent as
quickly as possible).

The bindep fallback tests are removed and the other jobs migrated to
fedora-26 nodes.

Nodes are reduced to 0 in nodepool for build removal

Change-Id: I7bf569c5d7196516c93f8a2b7306596a74eaa0c7
'}]
commit_message:
Remove/migrate Fedora 25 jobs

Fedora 26 is working with devstack jobs and (with bindep 2.5.0) tox
testing.  We wish to stop Fedora 25 builds to reduce the daily upload
requirements (but also, we try to keep this on the most recent as
quickly as possible).

The bindep fallback tests are removed and the other jobs migrated to
fedora-26 nodes.

Nodes are reduced to 0 in nodepool for build removal

Change-Id: I7bf569c5d7196516c93f8a2b7306596a74eaa0c7

subject: Correct nova virt type detection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 14:40:38.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/nova_virt_detect.yml'], 'message': 'Correct nova virt type detection

The nova role was attempting to detect the virt type if one was not
already pre-set however the tasks would only ever set the virt type to
"qemu" which forces all workloads to run in software instead of
hardware virt which has massive impacts in terms of workload
performance. This change corrects the virt type detection logic so that
it will run fall back to qemu should another virt type not be detected.

Change-Id: I78093808f03238c3c019797a06bba3ceca821239
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit db6c7dfb7310959c902c75ae3fe5c0e8c46a6572)
'}]
commit_message:
Correct nova virt type detection

The nova role was attempting to detect the virt type if one was not
already pre-set however the tasks would only ever set the virt type to
"qemu" which forces all workloads to run in software instead of
hardware virt which has massive impacts in terms of workload
performance. This change corrects the virt type detection logic so that
it will run fall back to qemu should another virt type not be detected.

Change-Id: I78093808f03238c3c019797a06bba3ceca821239
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit db6c7dfb7310959c902c75ae3fe5c0e8c46a6572)

subject: Do not output empty variables in inventory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-21 19:17:11.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo-ansible-inventory'], 'message': 'Do not output empty variables in inventory

Currently tripleo-ansible-inventory --static can create an invalid
inventory file:
The offending line appears to be:
[undercloud]
localhost
^ here

Attempted to read "/home/stack/validations_static_inventory" as ini file: /home/stack/validations_static_inventory:11: Expected key=value, got: cacert

The broken snippet can be:
...
ansible_connection = local
cacert
undercloud_swift_url = https://192.168.24.2:13808/v1/AUTH_ab355edddba843deafef01bf520e8648
...

We need to make sure that keys that have a 'None' dictionary do not
break the inventory file.

Change-Id: I009c7b52a4d1dabc3ceaad14a828f90ff3845b94
Closes-Bug: #1701239
'}]
commit_message:
Do not output empty variables in inventory

Currently tripleo-ansible-inventory --static can create an invalid
inventory file:
The offending line appears to be:
[undercloud]
localhost
^ here

Attempted to read "/home/stack/validations_static_inventory" as ini file: /home/stack/validations_static_inventory:11: Expected key=value, got: cacert

The broken snippet can be:
...
ansible_connection = local
cacert
undercloud_swift_url = https://192.168.24.2:13808/v1/AUTH_ab355edddba843deafef01bf520e8648
...

We need to make sure that keys that have a 'None' dictionary do not
break the inventory file.

Change-Id: I009c7b52a4d1dabc3ceaad14a828f90ff3845b94
Closes-Bug: #1701239

commit_message:
Fail if TLS + TCP are enabled for libvirtd

This patch fails the playbook if TLS and TCP connectivity are both
enabled. The role does not set certificates for libvirtd at this time
and these configurations will cause libvirtd to fail.

Closes-Bug: 1669436
Change-Id: Ib0448b63b6ce7c7e5d48975b2bd9d78ef5c1218c
(cherry picked from commit 37a8b27287c75e7b370af8946f613b6457bbc060)

commit_message:
Fail if TLS + TCP are enabled for libvirtd

This patch fails the playbook if TLS and TCP connectivity are both
enabled. The role does not set certificates for libvirtd at this time
and these configurations will cause libvirtd to fail.

Closes-Bug: 1669436
Change-Id: Ib0448b63b6ce7c7e5d48975b2bd9d78ef5c1218c
(cherry picked from commit 37a8b27287c75e7b370af8946f613b6457bbc060)

subject: Add securityGroups param to NovaNetwork joinInstance method in Core Library
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-14 09:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/NovaNetwork.yaml'], 'message': 'Add securityGroups param to NovaNetwork joinInstance method in Core Library

Commit 103f67815a1cb2c514241fbf2e897684b5a269ae added a securityGroups
parameter to the joinInstance method in meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/
Instance.yaml, but not in meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/
NovaNetwork.yaml. This omission makes deployments with Nova Network as a
driver fail. This commit adds the securityGroups parameter to
NovaNetwork.yaml.

Change-Id: If814d48d6491f1e16a5fb2b8632723224071d575
Closes-Bug: #1710576
'}]
commit_message:
Add securityGroups param to NovaNetwork joinInstance method in Core Library

Commit 103f67815a1cb2c514241fbf2e897684b5a269ae added a securityGroups
parameter to the joinInstance method in meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/
Instance.yaml, but not in meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/
NovaNetwork.yaml. This omission makes deployments with Nova Network as a
driver fail. This commit adds the securityGroups parameter to
NovaNetwork.yaml.

Change-Id: If814d48d6491f1e16a5fb2b8632723224071d575
Closes-Bug: #1710576

This patch fails the playbook if TLS and TCP connectivity are both
enabled. The role does not set certificates for libvirtd at this time
and these configurations will cause libvirtd to fail.

Closes-Bug: 1669436

subject: Ensure assigned-ips output is present in Heat template with Nova Network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-14 13:48:03.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/NovaNetwork.yaml'], 'message': 'Ensure assigned-ips output is present in Heat template with Nova Network

When using Murano with Nova Network, the assigned-ips output is only added to
the template when a floating IP is assigned. This makes the deployment fail
when the engine tries to get the list of IPs of the created instance.

This patch makes sure that the hostname-assigned-ips output is added to the
template also when a floating IP is not assigned.

Change-Id: I8970a34e7c0b9fefdc236b046d6506f778143f3a
Closes-Bug: 1710623
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure assigned-ips output is present in Heat template with Nova Network

When using Murano with Nova Network, the assigned-ips output is only added to
the template when a floating IP is assigned. This makes the deployment fail
when the engine tries to get the list of IPs of the created instance.

This patch makes sure that the hostname-assigned-ips output is added to the
template also when a floating IP is not assigned.

Change-Id: I8970a34e7c0b9fefdc236b046d6506f778143f3a
Closes-Bug: 1710623

commit_message:
Using assertFalse(A) instead of assertEqual(False, A)

This patch is to replace assertEqual(False, A) with assertFalse(A), which
the latter is more straightforward and easier to understand. Also the
relevant hacking rule is added.

Since assertEmpty() function has already been implemented in tempest,

Change-Id: I56da4434166d295e9f46df9e12310d815882b4a8

commit_message:
Replace assertEqual([], items) with assertEmpty(items)

Since assertEmpty() function has already been implemented in tempest,
let's use this function instead of generic assertEqual() function.
This change makes the code and the error messages to be more readable.
Therefore it improves maintainability a little bit.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I56da4434166d295e9f46df9e12310d815882b4a8

commit_message:
[doc] Replace http with https

Replaces some occurrences of http with https in order to preserve the security
zone behavior and ensure that resources are referenced/accessed via https.
This doesn't replace all occurrences because some of the URLs in our docs
need to be changed.

Change-Id: Ia1fcd7cb8d1bbec0f7380293445220c7e7b3a43c
(cherry picked from commit 24272f67c95a8140e230a1ec9983bc8601537159)

commit_message:
Fix the undefined InvalidInput exception

In https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/zun/api/controllers/
v1/containers.py, it raised InvalidInput, but this exception is undefined.
We can replace it with InvalidValue .

Change-Id: I1cb4a4429a916a076125d726e2df40c481cd41ea
Closes-Bug: #1712457

commit_message:
Add kube dashboard and remove kube ui

kube-ui [2] is deprecated and not actively maintained since long time.
Instead kubernetes dashboard [1] has lot of features and is actively
managed.
With this patch kube-ui is removed and kubernetes dashboard is added
and enabled in k8s cluster by default.

The kubernetes dashboard is enabled by default. To disable it, set the
label 'kube_dashboard_enabled' to False

Reference:
[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/dashboard
[2] https://github.com/kubernetes/kube-ui

(cherry-pick from 44d102a65efa934ed7867673775163e7f67482eb)

Change-Id: I391e0ed7e15c473b044c69c7101cbe541a6ec552

commit_message:
update comment for dropping support

it's apparently too late to make this change in Pike rc stage
so defer to Queens by changing the release version.

Change-Id: I006f41383dcef68d63a646665a56cbd4c3f93c4b

upgrade docker remote API version to 1.26 which supports passing
``runtime`` as input to create and run APIs.

subject: Optimize swift gate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 18:46:06.000000000', 'files': ['tests/inventory', 'tasks/swift_install.yml', 'bindep.txt', 'tests/os_swift-overrides-MR-B.yml', 'tests/os_swift-overrides-pypy.yml', 'tests/os_swift-overrides.yml', 'tests/os_swift-overrides-MR-A.yml', 'tests/inventory_MR_A', 'tests/inventory_MR_B', 'tests/test.yml'], 'message': 'Optimize swift gate

This patch contains five combined improvements.

1) Remove RabbitMQ from the gate

RabbitMQ is only needed in the swift gate if the ceilometer
middleware is being deloyed. This isn't enabled in the gate
job, so let's save some time and deploy memcached/galera
without RabbitMQ.

2) Bindep pyOpenSSL change

This commit also includes the pyOpenSSL bindep change in the
hopes that we can get the swift gate moving along again. ;)

3) Disable erasure code test for CentOS

Due to #1707220 we are running into issues with CentOS 7 running Erasure
Code storage policies on RAX hardware.

This patch temoprarily disables EC testing for CentOS 7, but we can
re-enable that once the package is backported to stable/ocata branch.

4) Pass packages as a list

This patch passes a list of packages to the package module
rather than using "with_items" and it should speed up the
package installation process.

5) Set package state to present

Change-Id: Ic7b13853ce00b0f8ac2181e46e2bd8dea5ce377e
Co-Authored-By: Andy McCrae <andy.mccrae@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit fa9f41f8233cc10e960e7acda9efc5b34847f873)
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize swift gate

This patch contains five combined improvements.

1) Remove RabbitMQ from the gate

RabbitMQ is only needed in the swift gate if the ceilometer
middleware is being deloyed. This isn't enabled in the gate
job, so let's save some time and deploy memcached/galera
without RabbitMQ.

2) Bindep pyOpenSSL change

This commit also includes the pyOpenSSL bindep change in the
hopes that we can get the swift gate moving along again. ;)

3) Disable erasure code test for CentOS

Due to #1707220 we are running into issues with CentOS 7 running Erasure
Code storage policies on RAX hardware.

This patch temoprarily disables EC testing for CentOS 7, but we can
re-enable that once the package is backported to stable/ocata branch.

4) Pass packages as a list

This patch passes a list of packages to the package module
rather than using "with_items" and it should speed up the
package installation process.

5) Set package state to present

Change-Id: Ic7b13853ce00b0f8ac2181e46e2bd8dea5ce377e
Co-Authored-By: Andy McCrae <andy.mccrae@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit fa9f41f8233cc10e960e7acda9efc5b34847f873)

commit_message:
Reduce CentOS AIO bootstrap pkg list

This patch removes the Development Tools package group from the
bootstrap-host role since it is not needed and it causes a lot of
additional packages to be installed.

On master, when upgrading from pike to queens in grenade, we already

commit_message:
Partially revert "Set resource class during upgrade"

This reverts part of commit 30bc3c0933a1072e5e4c48b4614f5f387ffd8327.
On master, when upgrading from pike to queens in grenade, we already
create all the nodes with a resource class being set, so no need to
update it. We still pass the parameters to verify and verify_noapi as
that's what grenade does.

Change-Id: Ic7c3218fe95ef9f73d358216831158a1ec025fba

commit_message:
Drop reconstructor stats when worker has no devices

If you're watching (new) node's reconstruction_last time to ensure a
cycle finishes since the last ring rebalance you won't ever see
reconstructors with no devices drop recon stats.

Change-Id: I84c07fc6841119b00d1a74078fe53f4ce637187b

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary schema check of ip address

This is to add more accurate ip version check in address
schema which will limit ip version value in [4, 6], and
to remove unnecessary schema check in testcases.

This also changes the 'pike' release to point to '9.1' since
we are considering 9.1 as the official pike release. In actuality,
it makes no difference since the rpc & object versions are the
same for both 9.0 and 9.1

(cherry picked from commit 92a40c9c1ca80c709009b3d70ca78ece807a50d3)
Change-Id: Id7913a56cd0848a68708a91e6ad055bdee08b465

commit_message:
Add 9.1 to release_mappings

This adds release '9.1' to the list of releases for doing
rolling upgrades.

This also changes the 'pike' release to point to '9.1' since
we are considering 9.1 as the official pike release. In actuality,
it makes no difference since the rpc & object versions are the
same for both 9.0 and 9.1

(cherry picked from commit 92a40c9c1ca80c709009b3d70ca78ece807a50d3)
Change-Id: Id7913a56cd0848a68708a91e6ad055bdee08b465

revisions:
[{'number': 33, 'created': '2017-08-18 09:14:22.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1702242-c917c832ac2fa4e1.yaml', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/drivers/linux/legacy_conntrack.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/drivers/linux/test_legacy_conntrack.py'], 'message': 'FW rule applied incorrectly if port specified is a range

When creating a firewall rule with port specified as a range of values,
e.g. [1], conntrack command for deleting current conntrack entries is
applied to the first number in the range, e.g. port #8778 in [1],
instead of the range of ports 8778:9000.

This incorrect behavior occurs because conntrack-tools
does not understand the port as a range of values.
This patch set fixes that issue by following the same method as done
in the netlink implementation in [2].

[1] "neutron firewall-rule-create --protocol tcp --action allow
--ip-version 4 --destination-port 8778:9000 --enabled True"
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438445/

Closes-Bug: #1702242
Co-Authored-By: Vu Cong Tuan <tuanvc@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: Ib17db09069a07f35109357d20b67b1acfa85c1a4
'}]
commit_message:
FW rule applied incorrectly if port specified is a range

When creating a firewall rule with port specified as a range of values,
e.g. [1], conntrack command for deleting current conntrack entries is
applied to the first number in the range, e.g. port #8778 in [1],
instead of the range of ports 8778:9000.

This incorrect behavior occurs because conntrack-tools
does not understand the port as a range of values.
This patch set fixes that issue by following the same method as done
in the netlink implementation in [2].

[1] "neutron firewall-rule-create --protocol tcp --action allow
--ip-version 4 --destination-port 8778:9000 --enabled True"
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438445/

Closes-Bug: #1702242
Co-Authored-By: Vu Cong Tuan <tuanvc@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: Ib17db09069a07f35109357d20b67b1acfa85c1a4

commit_message:
Update urls to Django 1.8 style

django.conf.urls.patterns() is deprecated since 1.8
We cannot use patterns() anymore.

Change-Id: I2a84a1ec7aebcbc488ae668e3a076bf9d72b0acf
Closes-Bug: #1703225
(cherry picked from commit 6bdb8a4f91bf28a639fea5bb38729f8c68d17606)

We can list all servers using `--all-tenants`, but we can't show
the server we list if not in current project event though we have enough
permissions. It seems inconsistent and unreasonable.

This patch adds the possibility to show a server which is not
current context project if permitted. If ``--all-tenants`` option

Change-Id: Ie46b0e89723022c12ff2dae301f248c56178b2ad

commit_message:
Fix can't show other tenant's server error

We can list all servers using `--all-tenants`, but we can't show
the server we list if not in current project event though we have enough
permissions. It seems inconsistent and unreasonable.

This patch adds the possibility to show a server which is not
current context project if permitted. If ``--all-tenants`` option
is present, we will find a server from all projects by id or name.

Closes-Bug: #1645929

Change-Id: Ie46b0e89723022c12ff2dae301f248c56178b2ad

commit_message:
Implement Block Storage Support -  Part 1

This patch adds support to attach volumes to VDU.
This patch does not deal with boot from volume case.

Change-Id: I4bee80610eaa4e2ec8a1ccb2a5d36fb723a09806
Implements: persistent-block-storage

Spec: Implement policies in code

Leverage oslo.policy to register default policies in the code similar
to how config options are handled.

commit_message:
[Api-ref] Add worker cleanup for service docs api

Allow triggering cleanup from API was introduced in cinder[1], but it's
not documented in the API docs. This change is to add it in the API docs.
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/363010/

Closes-bug: #1708809
Change-Id: Iadec39e8411a598372bc19bb566627a143faa0d8

commit_message:
Do not restart n-cpu during upgrade

As we do not upgrade nova on multinode grenade, there is no need to
restart it. This way we avoid breaking n-cpu service, as new
dependencies are installed and they may not work with old code.

Change-Id: Id0c13704654d43a663458b9c099a1a0477c746a6

commit_message:
Add Qdrouterd to the overcloud containers

The oslo.messaging amqp 1.0 driver supports the qdrouterd for
a direct messaging backend.

This patch
* Adds qdrouterd image to the overcloud containers

Change-Id: I159d38a644a0daf96ab82cc94489a0773e50f100

commit_message:
[doc] Replace http with https

Replaces some occurrences of http with https in order to preserve the security
zone behavior and ensure that resources are referenced/accessed via https.
This doesn't replace all occurrences because some of the URLs in our docs
need to be changed.

Change-Id: Ia1fcd7cb8d1bbec0f7380293445220c7e7b3a43c

commit_message:
Accept multiple registries in DockerInsecureRegistryAddress

We allow using multiple registries (e.g. for OpenStack vs. Ceph
container images). We should allow it also in the insecure registry
configuration.

subject: Fix Barbican's health checks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 17:45:04.000000000', 'files': ['group_vars/all/haproxy.yml'], 'message': "Fix Barbican's health checks

HAProxy healthchecks for Barbican are currently testing by sending
a HEAD request method, where it should be only using a GET.
The GET method only should test the /, because /healthcheck
was not implemented into barbican [1].

The expected result should be in 2xx/3xx range, which doesn't
require any special config in haproxy.

[1] See spec for /healthcheck
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/207317/5/specs/mitaka/healthcheck-endpoint.rst@117

Change-Id: I221ff0ad68de77d72a9c45db969ce2084a005774
Closes-Bug: 1702962
(cherry picked from commit bb48a1ab14480c88a922ecd3687c5d194f6bb8e8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Barbican's health checks

HAProxy healthchecks for Barbican are currently testing by sending
a HEAD request method, where it should be only using a GET.
The GET method only should test the /, because /healthcheck
was not implemented into barbican [1].

The expected result should be in 2xx/3xx range, which doesn't
require any special config in haproxy.

[1] See spec for /healthcheck
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/207317/5/specs/mitaka/healthcheck-endpoint.rst@117

Change-Id: I221ff0ad68de77d72a9c45db969ce2084a005774
Closes-Bug: 1702962
(cherry picked from commit bb48a1ab14480c88a922ecd3687c5d194f6bb8e8)

commit_message:
devstack: stop odl server after test

In order to flush ODL log, stop ODL server.
show odl related info in case of fullstack/functional test
Also a fix for ODL nitrogen case because the path to stop command
is a bit different.

SNMP timeout and retries are now configurable through ironic.conf. This

commit_message:
Make SNMP UDP transport settings configurable

SNMP timeout and retries are now configurable through ironic.conf. This
allows to have custom configurations when certain PDUs are slower than
others.

The config defaults are the same defaults that cmdgen.UdpTransportTarget
uses (1.0 second timeout and 5 retries). The config is now reflecting
these defaults.

Closes-Bug: #1640932
Change-Id: I2490902ad2e39e8e4dc34484799a0dae96bc57f8

subject: Depend on helper gem for spec_helper_acceptance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-20 21:10:45.000000000', 'files': ['Gemfile', 'spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'message': 'Depend on helper gem for spec_helper_acceptance

Instead of keeping a local copy of spec_helper_acceptance.rb and
requiring updates to all modules for any change, we can move it into the
common helper gem and require it from there. This will make it easier to
create and review changes that affect all puppet modules. Also change
the Gemfile to look for the gem in the local workspace if running in a
zuul environment.

Change-Id: Ie2c2210ddb22b948faca86668d17529f4803348b
'}]
commit_message:
Depend on helper gem for spec_helper_acceptance

Instead of keeping a local copy of spec_helper_acceptance.rb and
requiring updates to all modules for any change, we can move it into the
common helper gem and require it from there. This will make it easier to
create and review changes that affect all puppet modules. Also change
the Gemfile to look for the gem in the local workspace if running in a
zuul environment.

Change-Id: Ie2c2210ddb22b948faca86668d17529f4803348b

commit_message:
Support restore backup with specified volume type

Now restore a backup to a non exsiting volume only supports
the default volume_type.

This feature allows users to restore a backup with specified
volume type, it will be useful for multi-backend.

This change will add a new version "3.45".

APIImpact

Change-Id: I89942fed18d8acf0beb55774fc3e4018b6c54dfd

commit_message:
Add Ceilometer API and Collector service to roles_data

Ceilometer api and collector are disabled in pike. During upgrade case,
if its not in the roles_data the disable task doesnt get picked
up and continue to run. This should be removed in Queen cycle.

Change-Id: I3bf555ac9488fc6622e6a62a809150082a85ea54

subject: Update the playbook serial settings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 14:54:06.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-neutron-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml'], 'message': "Update the playbook serial settings

Many of our playbooks enfore the serial deployment of services. While
this is useful in certain cases It's super slow on large scale
deployments. This change modifies our serial settings so that many of
the services are deployed against 1 node first and then all the rest of
the services where it makes.

Change-Id: I842e98ebc29e0da0c3d7af3fd1d7f5592dfb3aa3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit eb81d64351dd12a1acbfef368ca27b73171fc6a3)

commit_message:
Update the playbook serial settings

Many of our playbooks enfore the serial deployment of services. While
this is useful in certain cases It's super slow on large scale
deployments. This change modifies our serial settings so that many of
the services are deployed against 1 node first and then all the rest of
the services where it makes.

Change-Id: I842e98ebc29e0da0c3d7af3fd1d7f5592dfb3aa3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit eb81d64351dd12a1acbfef368ca27b73171fc6a3)

The -m option as added 4 years ago, yet openSUSE ships an even older
version so the -m option is not available there and we are seeing the
followign errors:

opensuse423: tracepath: invalid option -- 'm'
opensuse423: Usage: tracepath [-n] [-b] [-l <len>] [-p port] <destination>
opensuse423: tracepath6: invalid option -- 'm'
opensuse423: Usage: tracepath6 [-n] [-b] [-l <len>] [-p port] <destination>

Change-Id: Ife7f393f484212cf520e8f1cf337ef94df2a3ba4
"}]
commit_message:
scripts: scripts-library.sh: Do not use the '-m' option on tracepath

The -m option as added 4 years ago, yet openSUSE ships an even older
version so the -m option is not available there and we are seeing the
followign errors:

opensuse423: tracepath: invalid option -- 'm'
opensuse423: Usage: tracepath [-n] [-b] [-l <len>] [-p port] <destination>
opensuse423: tracepath6: invalid option -- 'm'
opensuse423: Usage: tracepath6 [-n] [-b] [-l <len>] [-p port] <destination>

Lets try to use tracepath without the -m option if the former fails.

Link: https://github.com/iputils/iputils/commit/608419a7804caf36a359875d2fdae0b3eb181387
Change-Id: Ife7f393f484212cf520e8f1cf337ef94df2a3ba4

commit_message:
Treat Filter as Dict in get_policies

Currently QoS plugin's get_policies doesnt check if the filter
is a dict or not, though similar checks exist in get_rule_types()
and get_policy_rules().
This patch adds the check so that if any consumer passes filters=None
then it is converted to a dict.

TrivialFix
Partial-Bug: #1711165

Change-Id: Id50674c44cd3720dcd8fd6d66361d937599f5992
(cherry picked from commit 23ef48ad558def5ed2ce701e651a50590ac323c0)

commit_message:
Filter image list by deployed services

This change adds environment file arguments to
"openstack overcloud container image prepare" calls so that only
deployed images are in the generated files.

This will lead to upload commands only transferring the required
images to the undercloud registry, which should lead to a significant
speedup of containerised CI jobs.

Change-Id: I7166be7f07b5be7b4ded453b6e926396fbb1aa5a
Depends-On: I2769f52de1c4a128a921fa2e29ce32ae9c2d57e9
Closes-Bug: #1710992

commit_message:
Add 'hardware type' for Dell EMC iDRACs

The ironic project is engaged in a driver composition reform [0] which
introduces dynamic drivers. That reform places hardware vendors in
charge of defining a new form of drivers for their hardware. The new
form is called 'hardware type'. The reform will deprecate [1] the
existing ironic drivers, which are now referred to as 'classic drivers'.

This change adds a single new 'hardware type', 'idrac', for servers
controlled by Dell EMC integrated Dell Remote Access Controllers
(iDRAC).

[0]
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/7.0/driver-composition-reform.html
[1]
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/classic-drivers-future.html

Change-Id: Ie332a5adebfc229a79663c771c9f4409174dd8c9
Closes-Bug: #1705741
Related-Bug: #1676387

commit_message:
Wait for cleaning is completed after base smoke tests

Nova do not wait for cleaning is completed when deleting instance
as result after destroy phase ironic may still perform cleaning.
This patch ensures all nodes are available again after base smoke tests
finished and hypervisor stats are updated.

We still need to wait for resources after destroy phase which will be
done in separate patch as changes to grenade workflow are needed.

Change-Id: Ib6c5a0543533893664cb3e895286d0e226e364d2

subject: Don't use dlv-anchor-file with unbound
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 16:31:02.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/finalise.d/89-unbound'], 'message': "Don't use dlv-anchor-file with unbound

According to the unbound.conf manpage this value should no longer be
used. It creates lookaside queries for DNSSEC which introduces more
servers which can fail on us. This is no longer necessary beacuse root
servers have the appropriate DNSSEC configuration now.

Follow the unbound suggestion and make unbound more reliable by avoiding
DLV entirely.

Change-Id: Ib6c0cf83bfdeb1eb2f6f22951fd44ce9839cab92
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use dlv-anchor-file with unbound

According to the unbound.conf manpage this value should no longer be
used. It creates lookaside queries for DNSSEC which introduces more
servers which can fail on us. This is no longer necessary beacuse root
servers have the appropriate DNSSEC configuration now.

Follow the unbound suggestion and make unbound more reliable by avoiding
DLV entirely.

Change-Id: Ib6c0cf83bfdeb1eb2f6f22951fd44ce9839cab92

subject: Drastically simplify nodepool dsvm zuul layout
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-22 21:02:35.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Drastically simplify nodepool dsvm zuul layout

The old setup was fairly confusing and led to some unexpected job
execution by zuul. Simplify things so that the behavior is easier to
understand.

First we remove the rules for the gearman-sk-shim branch as that ended
up being unnecessary.

Next since nodepool dsvm jobs are not expected to vote on nodepool
switch everything over to -nv names for default non voting handling.

Finally don't run python27 dsvm jobs against feature/zuulv3 because
python2 support is being removed on that feature branch.

Note that we continue to run both python2 and python3 jobs against
master because they both work there. Once the feature/zuulv3 branch
merges into master we will drop the python2 jobs entirely.

Change-Id: I561d26f00c614faa0c0a6cfa793f2bb81be75163
"}]
commit_message:
Drastically simplify nodepool dsvm zuul layout

The old setup was fairly confusing and led to some unexpected job
execution by zuul. Simplify things so that the behavior is easier to
understand.

First we remove the rules for the gearman-sk-shim branch as that ended
up being unnecessary.

Next since nodepool dsvm jobs are not expected to vote on nodepool
switch everything over to -nv names for default non voting handling.

Finally don't run python27 dsvm jobs against feature/zuulv3 because
python2 support is being removed on that feature branch.

Note that we continue to run both python2 and python3 jobs against
master because they both work there. Once the feature/zuulv3 branch
merges into master we will drop the python2 jobs entirely.

Change-Id: I561d26f00c614faa0c0a6cfa793f2bb81be75163

commit_message:
[devstack] use resource classes by default

Scheduling based on properties is disabled completely.
Properties are still populated for nodes, we need to figure out
an appropriate wait loop without them first.

Change-Id: I58601cb8301e23560ea666d4ea088ce51af37ee6

subject: Bump the default bare metal (ironic) API version in the overcloud to 1.34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-28 09:31:41.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/constants.py', 'releasenotes/notes/ironic-api-version-pike-4264d815385cba7a.yaml'], 'message': 'Bump the default bare metal (ironic) API version in the overcloud to 1.34

This is the latest Pike API version, and it allows access to all new features
to the users of the client. No breaking changes were made to the API since Ocata.

Also issue a deprecation release note to inform the users that ironicclient will
change the default API version to latest, and we will follow this change for
the overcloud.

Depends-On: I3f8fbd38bb81930f8b5771faaef6005e689f4f26
Closes-Bug: #1706408
Change-Id: I4a5787effd3a3e62e6c16748f10471e3b0f6360f
'}]
commit_message:
Bump the default bare metal (ironic) API version in the overcloud to 1.34

This is the latest Pike API version, and it allows access to all new features
to the users of the client. No breaking changes were made to the API since Ocata.

Also issue a deprecation release note to inform the users that ironicclient will
change the default API version to latest, and we will follow this change for
the overcloud.

Depends-On: I3f8fbd38bb81930f8b5771faaef6005e689f4f26
Closes-Bug: #1706408
Change-Id: I4a5787effd3a3e62e6c16748f10471e3b0f6360f

subject: tripleo-common sudoers file is to permissive.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-21 13:46:13.000000000', 'files': ['sudoers'], 'message': 'tripleo-common sudoers file is to permissive.

The sudoers files as installed with openstack-tripleo-common package
is much too permissive. It contains several lines for the mistral
user that have wildcards that allow directory traversal with ".."
which grants full passwordless root access to the validations user.

Change-Id: I34073671c8f97d7bfbe1030ed52e6627a07dacfb
Related-Bug: 1705709
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo-common sudoers file is to permissive.

The sudoers files as installed with openstack-tripleo-common package
is much too permissive. It contains several lines for the mistral
user that have wildcards that allow directory traversal with ".."
which grants full passwordless root access to the validations user.

Change-Id: I34073671c8f97d7bfbe1030ed52e6627a07dacfb
Related-Bug: 1705709

subject: Update the playbook serial settings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 14:56:48.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-neutron-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml'], 'message': "Update the playbook serial settings

Many of our playbooks enfore the serial deployment of services. While
this is useful in certain cases It's super slow on large scale
deployments. This change modifies our serial settings so that many of
the services are deployed against 1 node first and then all the rest of
the services where it makes.

Change-Id: I842e98ebc29e0da0c3d7af3fd1d7f5592dfb3aa3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit eb81d64351dd12a1acbfef368ca27b73171fc6a3)
"}]
commit_message:
Update the playbook serial settings

Many of our playbooks enfore the serial deployment of services. While
this is useful in certain cases It's super slow on large scale
deployments. This change modifies our serial settings so that many of
the services are deployed against 1 node first and then all the rest of
the services where it makes.

Change-Id: I842e98ebc29e0da0c3d7af3fd1d7f5592dfb3aa3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit eb81d64351dd12a1acbfef368ca27b73171fc6a3)

commit_message:
Add functional force live migrate test

Forced live migration now seems to be failing, as after the movement of
the VM, the allocations are only present on the source host, and not on
the destination host.
The related assertions are commented out and replaced with wrong ones to
make the test pass.

Related-Bug: #1712008
Change-Id: I6856f57426db6f2f49daea86679b50d5d019fe19

commit_message:
Add functional live migrate test

Live migration now seems to be failing, as after the movement of the VM,
the allocations are both present on the source host, and on the
destination host.
The related assertions are commented out and replaced with wrong ones to
make the test pass.

Change-Id: Ib15d34c8da14dd006a0782e325d3c5e7b83fd0f1
Related-Bug: #1712045

subject: Consume upload-pypi role
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-08-22 20:42:42.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.yaml', 'playbooks/publish/pypi.yaml', 'playbooks/publish/testpypi.yaml'], 'message': 'Consume upload-pypi role

We created a new role in zuul-jobs, so lets start using it.

Make the job playbook such that it can just use named secrets so that we
can have a test job that uses the same playbook just with a different
secret. This should also allow someone to use the same job with their
own credentials if they wanted to.

Change-Id: I9440f54a40937bab6a688f14715e038080d6e944
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Consume upload-pypi role

We created a new role in zuul-jobs, so lets start using it.

Make the job playbook such that it can just use named secrets so that we
can have a test job that uses the same playbook just with a different
secret. This should also allow someone to use the same job with their
own credentials if they wanted to.

Change-Id: I9440f54a40937bab6a688f14715e038080d6e944
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: handlers: main: Force kill a container on openSUSE if it takes too long to stop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 18:05:53.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'message': 'handlers: main: Force kill a container on openSUSE if it takes too long to stop

It appears that lxc-1.1.5 is very slow when stopping a container. As a
result of which we pass the timeout (-t) option on openSUSE whilst this
is being investigated on the distribution level. This can also be
removed when lxc-2.X.X becomes the default option on openSUSE.

Link: https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1054609
Change-Id: I02299cb17477f63970e11ce3c8455cb12773a541
(cherry picked from commit 5209c772700d678bb4d1595cb20905c36bc15b15)
'}]
commit_message:
handlers: main: Force kill a container on openSUSE if it takes too long to stop

It appears that lxc-1.1.5 is very slow when stopping a container. As a
result of which we pass the timeout (-t) option on openSUSE whilst this
is being investigated on the distribution level. This can also be
removed when lxc-2.X.X becomes the default option on openSUSE.

Link: https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1054609
Change-Id: I02299cb17477f63970e11ce3c8455cb12773a541
(cherry picked from commit 5209c772700d678bb4d1595cb20905c36bc15b15)

commit_message:
Remove Developer Tools package group

This patch speeds up the gate jobs by removing the Development
Tools group and installs gcc instead. This will speed up deployments
by avoiding the installation of unnecessary packages.

Change-Id: Ifd61af212af4679366eafe872a2cf2feee0380e0
(cherry picked from commit 9719b171dbc4ce243d89e83b0607727206d3bbff)

subject: update handling of branches in list-changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 20:26:34.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/cmds/list_changes.py', 'openstack_releases/gitutils.py'], 'message': 'update handling of branches in list-changes

Use the existing heuristic to try to check out the right branch, but
then look at the available branches and if we find a stable branch
with the right series name check that out explicitly and use that name
for the branch so that the gerrit queries include the right
patches. This allows us to see patches on stable branches during the
release candidate period, for example.

Change-Id: Ie7a389acb3d912767a8e35dd0dd86053feb7b3d0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
update handling of branches in list-changes

Use the existing heuristic to try to check out the right branch, but
then look at the available branches and if we find a stable branch
with the right series name check that out explicitly and use that name
for the branch so that the gerrit queries include the right
patches. This allows us to see patches on stable branches during the
release candidate period, for example.

Change-Id: Ie7a389acb3d912767a8e35dd0dd86053feb7b3d0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: list all images in glance v1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 19:32:21.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/services/image/glance_v1.py'], 'message': "list all images in glance v1

The image listing for glance v1 doesn't account for non-admin users.
It assumes that the rally user is able to publicize an image.
The corresponding v2 list_images only tries to filter on visibility if
it was specified, but the v1 list_images only ever returns if is_public.

Change-Id: Id463ea263dfefbeb90c992c756dc8dbce2d874f2
"}]
commit_message:
list all images in glance v1

The image listing for glance v1 doesn't account for non-admin users.
It assumes that the rally user is able to publicize an image.
The corresponding v2 list_images only tries to filter on visibility if
it was specified, but the v1 list_images only ever returns if is_public.

Change-Id: Id463ea263dfefbeb90c992c756dc8dbce2d874f2

commit_message:
Add 9.1 to release_mappings

This adds release '9.1' to the list of releases for doing
rolling upgrades.

This also changes the 'pike' release to point to '9.1' since
we are considering 9.1 as the official pike release. In actuality,
it makes no difference since the rpc & object versions are the
same for both 9.0 and 9.1

Change-Id: Id7913a56cd0848a68708a91e6ad055bdee08b465

subject: Add CDH validation for attached volume size
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-22 07:54:39.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/plugins/exceptions.py', 'sahara/plugins/cdh/validation.py', 'sahara/plugins/cdh/plugin_utils.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/plugins/cdh/base_validation_tests.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/testutils.py'], 'message': 'Add CDH validation for attached volume size

CDH plugin has a DATANODE configuration parameter
called "dfs_datanode_du_reserved". If user sets cinder volume
as the storage location and sets volumes size less than the value
of the parameter, HDFS would not work. The cluster deployment
would be Error in "Starting" Step because of "Oozie Share Lib Upload
Failed".
This patch adds a validation in "Validating" Step before spawning
Cluster.

BTW, If this situation (volume size less than "du_reserved")
happen in Vanilla, Spark plugin, the deploy can finish successfully,
but the HDFS can't be used when upload file to HDFS.

Closes-Bug: #1709071
Change-Id: I840559d54ca474299eeec9812dc1573ab305bc1b
(cherry picked from commit bccc33396c63f0a27306b3bea5d0a7e174cd8c7e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add CDH validation for attached volume size

CDH plugin has a DATANODE configuration parameter
called "dfs_datanode_du_reserved". If user sets cinder volume
as the storage location and sets volumes size less than the value
of the parameter, HDFS would not work. The cluster deployment
would be Error in "Starting" Step because of "Oozie Share Lib Upload
Failed".
This patch adds a validation in "Validating" Step before spawning
Cluster.

BTW, If this situation (volume size less than "du_reserved")
happen in Vanilla, Spark plugin, the deploy can finish successfully,
but the HDFS can't be used when upload file to HDFS.

Closes-Bug: #1709071
Change-Id: I840559d54ca474299eeec9812dc1573ab305bc1b
(cherry picked from commit bccc33396c63f0a27306b3bea5d0a7e174cd8c7e)

subject: Move the ansible.cfg file outside $WORKSPACE
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 19:35:37.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'Move the ansible.cfg file outside $WORKSPACE

We've ran into issues before where downstream jobs leveraging a
devstack-gate based VM (TripleO ansible things) were being "polluted"
by the ansible.cfg left in the workspace.

The file has no other purpose than to configure Ansible for the
devstack-gate usage so let's move it out of there.

Change-Id: Icffefbf4602978739a696039f40751735b34a289
'}]
commit_message:
Move the ansible.cfg file outside $WORKSPACE

We've ran into issues before where downstream jobs leveraging a
devstack-gate based VM (TripleO ansible things) were being "polluted"
by the ansible.cfg left in the workspace.

The file has no other purpose than to configure Ansible for the
devstack-gate usage so let's move it out of there.

Change-Id: Icffefbf4602978739a696039f40751735b34a289

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-08-18 18:02:21.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/test_fwaas_v2.py', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "[DevStack] Configure iptables_v2 firewall driver for FWaaS V2.

both FWaaS versions. In case of V2 it means that all calls to

FwaasDriverBase metaclass and are actually no-op.

commit_message:
[DevStack] Configure iptables_v2 firewall driver for FWaaS V2.

Currently DevStack configures iptables v1 firewall driver for
both FWaaS versions. In case of V2 it means that all calls to
firewall group related driver methods are handled by the
FwaasDriverBase metaclass and are actually no-op.

Also updated FWaaS V2 scenario test to configure firewall rule
that'd allow SSH.

Change-Id: I0bdb4998f21d65564a30b6faa0250aad68f5c7b2

Change to zuul-jobs renamed upload-twine to upload-pypi and changed the
parameters a bit. Use the upload-pypi version instead.

Make the job playbook such that it can just use named secrets so that we
can have a test job that uses the same playbook just with a different
secret. This should also allow someone to use the same job with their
own credentials if they wanted to.

Change-Id: Ic22df34cd9efc0e1aa8900d1dfe17d640469c793
Depends-On: I2d93df042fc0b03ae89825a83f24da24b71bf2bd

commit_message:
Consume upload-pypi role

Change to zuul-jobs renamed upload-twine to upload-pypi and changed the
parameters a bit. Use the upload-pypi version instead.

Make the job playbook such that it can just use named secrets so that we
can have a test job that uses the same playbook just with a different
secret. This should also allow someone to use the same job with their
own credentials if they wanted to.

Change-Id: Ic22df34cd9efc0e1aa8900d1dfe17d640469c793
Depends-On: I2d93df042fc0b03ae89825a83f24da24b71bf2bd

commit_message:
Reduce rally sub-port count

This test is executed 4 times and creating 1000 Neutron ports
just to run this scenario 4 times results in this job taking
15 minutes to complete its iterations.

This cuts the count in half to 125 per execution to cut the run
time in half and ensure we don't get to close to the gate timeout.

This was done once before as part of
817a19c4b9ced01af9bbb6f7383283e3f0f0e9bd but unfortunately being
part of another SLA change resulted in it being reverted as part
of the SLA change.

Change-Id: I61466d87b002252efc163cbb5d03eafc5d4da3fb
(cherry picked from commit e97ee8a972a428b87875f86901ca2b9573913bc0)

subject: Trim rally scenario sizes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-22 15:09:43.000000000', 'files': ['rally-jobs/neutron-neutron.yaml'], 'message': 'Trim rally scenario sizes

During a normal run, the top three scenarios account for slightly
more than a half hour of runtime. Sample numbers:

Scenario                                    Load Duration Full Duration
NeutronNetworks.create_and_update_subnets       562.189   1,182.400
NeutronTrunks.create_and_list_trunk_subports    427.475    600.721
NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports           310.167    540.144

This patch reduces the resources created by each of the 3 by 75%. This
should save us an additional ~20 minutes during a normal gate run, which
should change our window for timeout from approximately a half hour on a
normal node to about 50 minutes.

This additional buffer should hopefully be enough to reduce the failure
rate for the rally job when it gets scheduled to a slow node.

Change-Id: I923b625f7dd3ebf794b6a9e097f5ed12ce446bb5
(cherry picked from commit f82667e8eb87d856622284ceb69c1410c8620d30)
'}]
commit_message:
Trim rally scenario sizes

During a normal run, the top three scenarios account for slightly
more than a half hour of runtime. Sample numbers:

Scenario                                    Load Duration Full Duration
NeutronNetworks.create_and_update_subnets       562.189   1,182.400
NeutronTrunks.create_and_list_trunk_subports    427.475    600.721
NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports           310.167    540.144

This patch reduces the resources created by each of the 3 by 75%. This
should save us an additional ~20 minutes during a normal gate run, which
should change our window for timeout from approximately a half hour on a
normal node to about 50 minutes.

This additional buffer should hopefully be enough to reduce the failure
rate for the rally job when it gets scheduled to a slow node.

Change-Id: I923b625f7dd3ebf794b6a9e097f5ed12ce446bb5
(cherry picked from commit f82667e8eb87d856622284ceb69c1410c8620d30)

subject: Correct nova virt type detection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-22 14:57:02.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/nova_virt_detect.yml'], 'message': 'Correct nova virt type detection

The nova role was attempting to detect the virt type if one was not
already pre-set however the tasks would only ever set the virt type to
"qemu" which forces all workloads to run in software instead of
hardware virt which has massive impacts in terms of workload
performance. This change corrects the virt type detection logic so that
it will run fall back to qemu should another virt type not be detected.

Change-Id: I78093808f03238c3c019797a06bba3ceca821239
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit db6c7dfb7310959c902c75ae3fe5c0e8c46a6572)
'}]
commit_message:
Correct nova virt type detection

The nova role was attempting to detect the virt type if one was not
already pre-set however the tasks would only ever set the virt type to
"qemu" which forces all workloads to run in software instead of
hardware virt which has massive impacts in terms of workload
performance. This change corrects the virt type detection logic so that
it will run fall back to qemu should another virt type not be detected.

Change-Id: I78093808f03238c3c019797a06bba3ceca821239
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit db6c7dfb7310959c902c75ae3fe5c0e8c46a6572)

commit_message:
Remove use of positional decorator

The positional decorator results in poorly maintainable code in
a misguided effort to emulate python3's key-word-arg only notation
and functionality. This patch removes oslo.context dependance
on the positional decorator.

Change-Id: I9b83917fedd00a8d4fdf904208a17ebdc5cda59a

commit_message:
Remove Developer Tools package group

This patch speeds up the gate jobs by removing the Development
Tools group and installs gcc instead. This will speed up deployments
by avoiding the installation of unnecessary packages.

Change-Id: Ifd61af212af4679366eafe872a2cf2feee0380e0
(cherry picked from commit 9719b171dbc4ce243d89e83b0607727206d3bbff)

commit_message:
Fix for monasca modules and other minor changes

This change fixes monasca modules to work with the latest version
of monascaclient.

Other minor changes:
  - Use cryptography instead of pycrypto
  - Removed duplicate variable for monasca_api_port
  - Added static paths for dashboards

Change-Id: Ib4fe27c276413bb2e1e5da3fe532d824745c5b99

commit_message:
Parameter modifications of edit-constraints

Having neutron-lib in the upper-constraints file causes
the api-ref build fail. With this change neutron-lib is
removed by edit-constraints.

Change-Id: Ic6ae5ca829f73477c54999bab3eb5d9320636219
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

Toggle percona repo without extra-vars

Currently overriding this setting requires the
use of extra-vars. This change allows it to be
done via any other variable override.

subject: Correct group name in config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-21 22:47:19.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/config.py'], 'message': "Correct group name in config

Help text for enable_image_import refers to [TASKS] whereas the
related option group is named [task].  This patch corrects the
text so that operators don't add config for a group that doesn't
exist and then wonder why it's not having any effect.

Closes-bug: #1712110

Change-Id: Icd79be4eb9d363e70955dbe208aba8564cf21e8e
(cherry picked from commit d38c8d23975e37bc4450d0ac707f3c4ab48f2011)
"}]
commit_message:
Correct group name in config

Help text for enable_image_import refers to [TASKS] whereas the
related option group is named [task].  This patch corrects the
text so that operators don't add config for a group that doesn't
exist and then wonder why it's not having any effect.

Closes-bug: #1712110

Change-Id: Icd79be4eb9d363e70955dbe208aba8564cf21e8e
(cherry picked from commit d38c8d23975e37bc4450d0ac707f3c4ab48f2011)

subject: Change pure drivers default replication interval
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-14 18:01:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/pure.py', 'doc/source/configuration/block-storage/drivers/pure-storage-driver.rst', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_pure.py', 'releasenotes/notes/pure-default-replica-interval-07de0a56f61c7c1e.yaml'], 'message': "Change pure drivers default replication interval

With newer versions of Purity the previous default
value would not be allowed, the minimum is 60 minutes
(3600 seconds).

While this does change a default config value, it
goes from a non-working-crash-the-driver-at-startup
value to a working one.

Along with this I'm bumping the driver version
numbers and fixing typo in the docs about the purity
version (this bug was found with REST API 1.5).

Change-Id: I21148f0d56cb7ce376107253aa67fc808fa40f9f
Closes-Bug: #1709720
(cherry picked from commit f82d2bf6f13a360f6a1c08066cf682e2e07043db)
"}]
commit_message:
Change pure drivers default replication interval

With newer versions of Purity the previous default
value would not be allowed, the minimum is 60 minutes
(3600 seconds).

While this does change a default config value, it
goes from a non-working-crash-the-driver-at-startup
value to a working one.

Along with this I'm bumping the driver version
numbers and fixing typo in the docs about the purity
version (this bug was found with REST API 1.5).

Change-Id: I21148f0d56cb7ce376107253aa67fc808fa40f9f
Closes-Bug: #1709720
(cherry picked from commit f82d2bf6f13a360f6a1c08066cf682e2e07043db)
